Amazing

This game, is incredible. The gameplay is nearly flawless, and the idea is brilliant. But first let me addresss everything the naysayers about this game say. 1: Predictable storyline. Hmmmmmmmmmmm I would agree with you there... except you didn't play the whole game. Seriously, almost everyone who says this has not played the whole game. And for the few who did, you clearly did not watch your surroundings enough. The point of the story was to make you want to play more, and it certainly did well on that note. 2: Not very hard. Again, play the whole game first. True, the game was not THAT hard, but I cannot think of a  puzzle game that executes the gameplay as well as portal does. While the game itself was not terribly hard, the community has certainly made some head scratching test chambers that will make you want to eat your own words. 3: Crashes. The game does not crash anymore (except on windows 8 so far) so ignore those reviewers who say that because their review is now irrelevent. 
Final score 9/10

I bought this game today on Steam. I previous played the first Portal twice on xbox and the second Portal three times (co-op & single player) on xbox. The one on xbox didn't have all the extras like the one on steam. So I bought the steam (because it was on sale and had mods and extras) . This game is on my top ten favorite games. I usually play with my brother as P-body.

Remember Portal? What if the thrill of discovery and the dark tingle of unraveling the story were gone and in its place was more spectacle and a few new mechanics?

P2 can't ever live up to the the brilliance of the first, but saying a game is "worse than Portal" isn't saying a whole lot. Most games are worse than Portal. For its part, P2 is clever and funny with some decent puzzling, and fewer dexterity challenges than the first (for better or worse as you like it.) Co-op mode has some pretty uniquely great levels with epiphanic "ah-ha" moments.

I mean what do you want? Portal was great. Here's more Portal.

the best game ever!

Three reasons to buy this game:
1-Puzzles; a lot of them are fun to do and provide a good challenge (except for a couple, but that's what walkthrough videos on YouTube are for).
2-Dialogue; you learn a lot of ways to call someone fat and say demotivating stuff about the control group.
3-Song in the Credits; this was the first game that I sat through the credits for (because the song was amazing, though maybe not as good as 'Still Alive' from Portal).

Overall, this is one of the best games I've played, because this game is GREAT overall. The only way you can't like it is if you don't have patience, a sense of humor, or any taste in music. And did I forget to mention that the song at the end and dialogue are really good?

This game is the definition of humor with all the puns that are made.  Each character met has a different approach to comedy (whether they know it or not!).  The puzzles are challenging and can drive people mad from time to time, but they are worth it.  The voice acting is very good and I suggest that you listen to what they're saying rather than move ahead all of the time.
I have not used the online multiplayer very often (I am frustrated that I only own it on the PS3; I lost the code to transfer to Steam shortly after opening it), but from others who have used it often, it can be quite entertaining.  The only part of this game that I didn't like was that it ended; I honestly wish that the game could never end with all the witty remarks and challenging puzzles.
This game also brings to the table a question of Chell's history (I won't say anything more on the subject)
All-in-all, this is one of my favorite games and I am sad that I only own it on the PS3 (if anyone wants to donate it... ;) )

Portal 2, in my opinion I believe that Portal 2 is one of the best games ever invented. In this game you get to solve tests in the facility of Aperture, and don't worry these tests are not the boring pencil and paper tests, all the tests that you experience are in rooms that look somewhat alien to people, what I mean by alien is that everything looks incredibly evolved from what you would normaly see! Aperture Laboratories tests humans capability to endure physical puzzles while using a portal gun that will allow you to create portals, 2 portals to be accurate. When you are far into the game you are being supervised by GLaDOS who is a incredible piece of artifical intelligance, GLaDOS is not very friendly too you because you killed her in Portal 1, not to worry though because you have a little robotic friend named Wheatly to help you along the way. I will not get too far into the story of the game because that would spoil alot of it. Portal 2 is a puzzle/adventure game that is an amazing experience, I rate this game six out of five stars and yes I said six, I recommend this game to everyone who wishes to try something new.

Jogo muito bom. Conta com um Single-Player e um Cooperativo muito bons, com puzzles fáceis e complexos, e, ao mesmo tempo, nos conta uma história com seus únicos e engraçados personagens (GLaDOS e Wheatley).
Um ótimo jogo para quem gosta de testar seu raciocínio e se divertir com as falas da GLaDOS, a A.I. mais cômica dos games.
O jogo também consta com a Steam Workshop, aumentando o tempo de "vida útil" do jogo infinitamente, já que fornece milhares de mapas Single-Player e Cooperativo, alguns tão bons quanto os do próprio jogo e alguns melhores.
This game is for smart people. Exercise your brain and challenge the machine!
